articles.title: Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency after CEO’s name appears in Epstein files
articles.description:
The Irish-American punk band from Quincy, Mass. joins other entertainers distancing themselves from the agency.

The post Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency after CEO’s name appears in Epstein files appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Dropkick Murphys severed ties with Wasserman agency amid Epstein scandal on February 13, 2026.
The Quincy-based band joins other entertainers distancing themselves from the agency's CEO.
This decision reflects growing scrutiny of associations with controversial figures in the entertainment industry.

articles.title: Video: Water pours into South Station from newly renovated ceiling
articles.description:
Cleanup is underway, according to the MBTA.

The post Video: Water pours into South Station from newly renovated ceiling appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Water leaks from the newly renovated ceiling at South Station, causing disruption.
MBTA has initiated cleanup efforts following the incident on February 13, 2026.
Passengers may experience delays and inconvenience due to ongoing repairs at the station.

articles.title: Brock Nelson scores twice as US men’s hockey opens Olympic slate by rolling over Latvia
articles.description:
The U.S. stopped Latvia’s surge in its tracks, taking a 5-1 win.

The post Brock Nelson scores twice as US men’s hockey opens Olympic slate by rolling over Latvia appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: US men's hockey defeats Latvia 5-1 in Olympic opener on February 13.
Brock Nelson scores two goals, showcasing talent for Boston hockey fans.
Victory boosts US team's morale ahead of upcoming Olympic matches.

articles.title: Emily Chan and Spencer Howe of The Skating Club of Boston went through injuries, uncertainty to reach the Olympics
articles.description:
“Our career has come with a lot of ups and downs ... To be able to achieve this kind of level of skating together just makes it that much more special.”

The post Emily Chan and Spencer Howe of The Skating Club of Boston went through injuries, uncertainty to reach the Olympics appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Emily Chan and Spencer Howe qualify for the Olympics, representing The Skating Club of Boston.
Both athletes overcame significant injuries and uncertainty in their skating careers.
Their success inspires local skaters and highlights Boston's commitment to figure skating.

articles.title: Ask the Gardener: How snow cover can benefit your garden come spring
articles.description:
Boston-area yards have been covered in snow for weeks — a stable condition for dormant plants

The post Ask the Gardener: How snow cover can benefit your garden come spring appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Snow cover in Boston protects dormant plants from harsh winter conditions.
Weeks of snow provide insulation, benefiting local gardens for spring growth.
Residents can expect healthier plants due to improved soil moisture retention.
